üìöBook Tour & Book Reviewüìö

QOTD: What‚Äôs your favorite musical group/artist? 

Thank you to @turnthepagetours & @simonteen for this copy of Bright by Jessica Jung! I have a giveaway up for this on my blog, link in my linktree. 

SYNOPSIS:
The sequel to the instant New York Times bestseller Shine! 
Crazy Rich Asians meets Gossip Girl in this knockout series from Jessica Jung, K-pop legend, fashion icon, and founder of the international luxury brand, Blanc & Eclare.

Couture gowns, press parties, international travel. Rachel Kim is at the top of her game. Girls Forever is now the number-one K-pop group in the world, and her fame skyrockets after her viral airport styling attracts the attention of fashion‚Äôs biggest names. Her life‚Äôs a swirl of technicolor glamour and adoring fans. Rachel can‚Äôt imagine shining any brighter.
The only thing that‚Äôs missing is love‚Äîbut Rachel‚Äôs determined to follow the rules. In her world, falling in love can cost you everything.
Enter Alex. When Rachel literally falls head over designer heels into his lap on a crowded metro, she‚Äôs tempted to give up her anti-love vows. Alex is more than just heart-stopping dimples and adorably quirky banter. He believes in Rachel‚Äôs future‚Äîboth in music and in fashion.
But the higher you rise, the farther you have to fall. And when a shocking act of betrayal shatters her world, Rachel must finally listen to her heart.

My Review:
4/5 ‚≠êÔ∏è 
I really enjoyed this book just as much as Shine. I was a little confused at first over the 5 year time jump, but I loved seeing Rachel 5 years in the future. This definitely kept my attention, and I loved the romance, drama, and intrigue! The petty drama within this group‚Ä¶ Wow. But if you love Kpop I highly suggest you read these books, I do wonder how much is based off of Jessica‚Äôs own experience! Maybe she will share that one day.

Favorite read of April? 

To me, April simultaneously flew by and dragged. The last few weeks felt like months, but April as a whole feels like a blink. That might partly be helped by the fact that my reading was soooooo slow. With AP exams and tests, I spent way too much time studying, and nowhere near enough time reading. 

But now, I can get back to reading!! Took my environmental science exam on Tuesday, and my English one today. My brain is dead, and I can't write for the life of me, but I did it!! Don't have to study anymore, I can dive right back into reading! 

So of course, the first thing I did after getting home today was binge Bright. It was so adorable! The perfect read for a brain-dead binge, it was sheer fluff and fun. It was exactly what I needed after a long day :D

‚≠êÔ∏èGIVEAWAY‚≠êÔ∏è
Welcome to my stop on @TurnthePageTours‚Äô release tour for Bright by @jessica.syj!  In honor of this fun sequel, I will be sharing my review and details on how you can win your very own copy of both Bright and Shine!

How to win your own copy of Shine and Bright by Jessica Jung

-To enter to win a copy of Shine and Bright, head over to my blog post (link in my bio) to fill out the super easy Rafflecopter form! -That‚Äôs all it takes, and you‚Äôll be entered to win!
-Disclaimer: This giveaway is being run through Turn the Page Tours and @simonteen, and is not affiliated with Instagram.

As someone who is largely unfamiliar with the world of K-Pop, I was a little nervous about starting to read Shine, as I was worried that I would be lost.  Fortunately, this was not at all the case!  Jessica Jung pulled me into the world of K-Pop seamlessly, providing context when necessary and allowing me to focus on the story rather than on the unfamiliarity of the world. I loved the characters, the drama, and the high stakes that come along with fame.  I was especially a fan of how the romance between Rachel and Alex was written in Bright.  Their connection felt believable and relatable, even if their circumstances are a bit different than my own.

My Recommendation- 
Whether or not you listen to a lot of K-Pop, Shine and Bright are both such engaging and fun reads!  I would especially recommend this book to people who enjoy reading about life in the spotlight, and the challenges that come along with being in the public eye!

Are you into K-pop? I‚Äôm not great at keeping up with new music and bands, but it felt impossible not to eventually get caught up in K-pop somehow. It was admittedly the K-pop fans, their enthusiasm, and the way they banded together to protest that caught my attention more than the music. But I‚Äôm slowly listening to more and more. 
üåü
I dipped my toe into this scene far too late to recognize who Jessica Jung is (K-pop legend and former lead singer of the girl group Girls Generation from 2007-2014) but I always find it really intriguing when people write about something they are intimately familiar with. (I admittedly picked up Bill Clinton‚Äôs presidential thriller because I was just too curious what a former president would write about in a fiction book about a president). I‚Äôve always thought it would be cool to be a talented and famous singer and I‚Äôm eager to find some interviews by Jessica Jung to see in what ways her career influenced her book, and to dive into it!
üåü
Synopsis: 
What would you give for a chance to live your dreams? For seventeen-year-old Korean American Rachel Kim, the answer is almost everything. Six years ago, she was recruited by DB Entertainment‚Äîone of Seoul‚Äôs largest K-pop labels, known for churning out some of the world‚Äôs most popular stars. The rules are simple: Train 24/7. Be perfect. Don‚Äôt date. Easy right? Not so much. As the dark scandals of an industry bent on controlling and commodifying beautiful girls begin to bubble up, Rachel wonders if she‚Äôs strong enough to be a winner, or if she‚Äôll end up crushed‚Ä¶ Especially when she begins to develop feelings for K-pop star and DB golden boy Jason Lee. It‚Äôs not just that he‚Äôs charming, sexy, and ridiculously talented. He‚Äôs also the first person who really understands how badly she wants her star to rise.¬†
üåü

October is the perfect time to shout-out Asian authors and books üåè
.
(Part 2/4)
‚Ä¢
Thank you @glasstownent for the free book ARC and merch!
‚Ä¢
This ARC was provided for review, but in no way affects the following impartial and unbiased review:
‚Ä¢
4*
Pros: A perfect mix of the love for K-pop and the  endearment of K-dramas. Down-to-earth portrayal of what it is like to begin a life as a musician and performer in Korea. Talks about the exploitation by big entertainment companies, the poor living conditions, the pressure and impossible expectations, the double standards and sexism, among many other (often taboo) issues in the industry. Also showcases the love for the art, the magic of performing and doing what you love. Can't wait for the sequel.
.
Cons: Lackluster romance and romantic interest. Includes some of my least favourite tropes, such as the ditching-your-friends-as-soon-as-you-make-it trope that definitely should not still be a thing.
‚Ä¢
Shine, by Jessica Jung is fresh on the shelves, grab your copy!
‚Ä¢

Happy New Year all you bookish babes!!! üéÜüéâü•≥
.
.
Do any of you make resolutions? I‚Äôm not really one to make them honestly, I hate setting myself up for failure. So if I had to say the goal this year is to just be better. That‚Äôs all I want. To be a better human, a better wife, a better friend and a better coworker. ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
.
.
Shine took me (Annie) by complete surprise, though I‚Äôm not entirely sure why. It‚Äôs a contemporary that features a girl who‚Äôs going for her dream, taking her last shot at becoming the next big K-pop star. Of course there‚Äôs a boy. Of course there‚Äôs drama and shenanigans. And there‚Äôs a really good discussion on double standards in the industry. Now I know next to nothing about K-pop so I can‚Äôt tell how accurate all that is but I‚Äôm willing to bet it‚Äôs pretty accurate since the author is a former K-pop star so... but I really enjoyed this book. I thought it was lovely and such a fun escape from the common Hollywood actress story while still have the drama of being famous, or almost-famous. Also a super cool side note I figured out while in the store, there are three different spine colors and three different author photos! It took me wayyyyy too long to decide which one to getü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüéÜüíóüçæ
.
.

-Jessica Jung (@jessica.syj)‚ú®Ô∏è

‚ú®Ô∏è Q: Are you a fan of K-pop?

‚ú®Ô∏è A: I can't say I'm a huge fan but I've listened to a few songs mainly by BTS. Yesterday I met up with a old college friend and her Philly BTS army friends and we all spent the day going to various BTS pop-up events and BTS Army meet-up activities. Even though I wasn't a fan it was a great time! If you want to read about K-pop I would recommend Shine, it's been my favorite K-pop book so far but it does get a bit darker than I would've expected- and the author is a former K-pop star in Girls Generation! üåü

But the higher you rise, the farther you have to fall. And when a shocking act of betrayal shatters her world, Rachel must finally listen to her heart.

‚ú®What would you do if you were in the biggest K-pop group in the world?

Rachel Kim is at the top of her game with her group Girls Forever. But there‚Äôs a lot more underneath the veneer of glitz and glam‚Ä¶

BRIGHT by Jessica Jung was such a fun read (see the full summary in the comments)! Thank you @turnthepagetours and @simonteen for having me on this blog and bookstagram tour! Swipe to see my BRIGHT-inspired playlist ‚û°Ô∏è

üîóRead my review (and enter the giveaway üëÄ) at the link in bio!

Do you listen to kpop? Who are some of your favorite artists? ü´∂

Some of my favorites are IU, BTS, Seventeen, Twice, Mamamoo, and SNSD! I also recently started listening to Enhypen!

I remember when Shine came out, I was super interested in reading a novel written by a kpop idol. And now the sequel, Bright by Jessica Jung, is coming out! üíì

A few years after the events that occurred in Shine, we follow Rachel as she falls in love and tries to find her true self. Similarly to the first book, Rachel is subjected to the harsh dynamics faced as an idol within the kpop industry with unexpected betrayals. Drama and intrigue thus ensue, along with a possible romance? üëÄ

Compared to the first book, Bright focuses a little less on the criticism and critique that comes alongside fame and more on the romance that develops between Rachel and Alex. I must admit, I did find the first book a bit more intriguing as we learn about everything behind-the-scenes of a kpop idol (written from a kpop idol herself)! There's a lot of double standards, body shaming, and foul play as Rachel enters the industry. That's not to say that she isn't subjected to similar treatment even after she's become more famous, but the author has instead chosen to prioritize Rachel's journey in self-discovery more in this sequel. We learn more about Rachel's entry into the world of fashion and music as well as how she manages a potential relationship.

As someone who got into kpop somewhat more recently (around 2 years ago?), I found this duology to be fascinating insight into the kpop industry and the struggles that idols face. I still wonder to what extent these stories are fiction, and how much of Rachel's experiences mirror the authors...ü§î

Thank you to @turnthepagetours and @simonteen for sending me this copy and allowing me to join this tour! You can find my review in my bio (+ a giveaway and the full schedule for this tour)!‚ú®

‚òÅÔ∏è I also really appreciate that the publishers created a reversible dust jacket so that you can have the covers match both the paperback and the original hardcover!

#turnthepagetours #brighttour #shinebook #brightbook #jessicajung

‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
------review------
I looooove me a K-pop book, but it's so rare to get one focused on a new adult age range. Rachel debuted with Girls Forever 5 years ago, but is still having issues finding balance in her life. Everything that I loved about Shine is still present in this book - the fashion, the music, the drama, but there are darker elements as well. We get to examine some of the more toxic group dynamics of Girls Forever, as well as how far people will go to get ahead. It was amazing seeing Rachel enter the world of fashion and business, but I hope we get a third book still. Maybe with another time skip? Rachel's story is far from over, and she definitely has some unsettled business. (Also Alex is THE cutest boyfriend. I'd love to wake up to his texts)
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
*Thank you to Turn the Page Tours and Simon & Schuster Children's for an ARC in exchange for my honest review*

What are some book sequels you‚Äôre excited to read this year?
.
.
üí´ Bright is the follow up to Shine by @jessica.syj and it was a fun read! 
If you haven‚Äôt yet read Shine, you‚Äôll definitely want to before reading this one! I really enjoyed seeing our main character, Rachel, in a different way in this one with the time jump that takes place! It was something I wasn‚Äôt expecting but I really appreciated reading it this way! Overall, it was fun and kept me entertained! 

If you‚Äôre familiar with Shine, you‚Äôll notice that the books have gotten a new look with brand new covers for both! One really cool thing that the publisher has done is that the Bright dust jacket is reversible so you can have it match either the new cover or the original cover of the first book! Isn‚Äôt that the coolest thing?! ü§©

.
.
üí´ Bright is the follow up to Shine by @jessica.syj and it was a fun read! 
If you haven‚Äôt yet read Shine, you‚Äôll definitely want to before reading this one! I really enjoyed seeing our main character, Rachel, in a different way in this one with the time jump that takes place! It was something I wasn‚Äôt expecting but I really appreciated reading it this way! Overall, it was fun and kept me entertained! 

If you‚Äôre familiar with Shine, you‚Äôll notice that the books have gotten a new look with brand new covers for both! One really cool thing that the publisher has done is that the Bright dust jacket is reversible so you can have it match either the new cover or the original cover of the first book! Isn‚Äôt that the coolest thing?! ü§©

üíéTour Stopüíé

Welcome to my stop for Bright by @jessica.syj alongside @turnthepagetours! 

Bright is YA contemporary novel centered around the world of KPOP. It is the sequel to the NYT bestseller Shine and it will published by @simonteen on May 10, 2022! Thanks to them for sending me a stunning copy!

üíéSynopsisüíé

Crazy Rich Asians meets Gossip Girl in this knockout series from Jessica Jung, K-pop legend, fashion icon, and founder of the international luxury brand, Blanc & Eclare.

Couture gowns, press parties, international travel. Rachel Kim is at the top of her game. Girls Forever is now the number-one K-pop group in the world, and her fame skyrockets after her viral airport styling attracts the attention of fashion‚Äôs biggest names. Her life‚Äôs a swirl of technicolor glamour and adoring fans. Rachel can‚Äôt imagine shining any brighter.
The only thing that‚Äôs missing is love‚Äîbut Rachel‚Äôs determined to follow the rules. In her world, falling in love can cost you everything.
Enter Alex. When Rachel literally falls head over designer heels into his lap on a crowded metro, she‚Äôs tempted to give up her anti-love 
vows. Alex is more than just heart-stopping dimples and adorably quirky banter. He believes in Rachel‚Äôs future‚Äîboth in music and in fashion.
But the higher you rise, the farther you have to fall. And when a shocking act of betrayal shatters her world, Rachel must finally listen to her heart.

üíéReviewüíé

QOTD: stand-alones or sequels?
AOTD: I like stand-alones within a series. That way the romance isn‚Äôt dragged on for multiple books, but we still get the characters we know and love. 

I was so excited when I saw that Shine by @jessica.syj was getting a sequel! I loved the first book and knew that I had to read the second. Thank you to @turnthepagetours and @simonteen for organizing this book tour! 

I received both an ARC copy paperback (pictured) and a hardcover with a reversible jacket which I‚Äôll be sharing soon! They are both gorgeous and I can‚Äôt decide which one is my favorite.

And vice versa.
.
Rehearsal stems from the archaic French word meaning ‚Äúto repeat.‚Äù In a very real sense, as believers, we become what we rehearse-  or what we repeat- day after day. There is an undeniable potency in holy repetition, and I, for one, have a deep need for it. If we rehearse the truth that we are indeed the beloved of God through Christ, then when circumstances challenge that immutable truth, spiritual muscle memory will take over. The truth will rise, and the lie will sink- if the truth has been deeply rehearsed into our spiritual sinews.
.
I‚Äôm reminding my heart today: rehearse what is true, what is reflective of the Gospel, what embodies the ways and words of the Divine Author of Hebrews. For, in every sense that truly matters, I will be what I rehearse.  I will become what I repeat. ‚ù§Ô∏è
.
